title: Stephen Paddock
summary: Stephen Craig Paddock (April 9, 1953 – October 1, 2017)[6] was an American mass murderer who perpetrated the 2017 Las Vegas shooting.[7][8][9] Paddock opened fire into a crowd of approximately 22,000 concert-goers attending a country music festival on the Las Vegas Strip, killing 60 people[lower-alpha 1] and injuring 867 (411 of whom were wounded by gunfire).[10][11] Paddock committed suicide in his hotel room following the shooting.[2][12] The incident is the deadliest mass shooting by a lone shooter in United States history. Paddock's motive remains officially undetermined,[13][14] and the possible factors are the subject of speculation.
